comments:
3.0M7
org.eclipse.ui.plugin.AbstractUIPlugin and org.eclipse.core.runtime.Plugin
were changed in 3.0:
They need now a default constructor for the plugin class. In Eclipse 2.x there 
was only a constructor with a descriptor.
This change is not backward compatible and neither documented in the porting 
guide nor reflected in the migration tool.

Florian Hawlitzek
Hawlitzek IT-Consulting GmbH

You can still use the constructor that was available before. Subclasses don't
have to support the no-arg constructor. Why isn't it backward compatible?

You only need to have a 0-arg constructor if you are writing a real bundle and 
that you want your bundle activator to inherits from those classes. Otherwise 
you do not need it. Please see bug 50448 comment 19.
